description.narrative:
- Jobs: The expansion will create 112 new direct jobs. In addition to the direct jobs created through the hotel's operations, the Project will create temporary jobs during its construction period, and a support a number of indirect jobs through its supply chain. Direct employees will benefit from training, contributing to the upskilling of the country's workforce, as the Project is expected to hire low skilled, low income local employees, and train them to gain basic skill sets.
-Local Linkages and Community Engagement: 3B is committed to developing local communities and expects to source as much as possible through local suppliers, to train its suppliers to help them reach required quality standards. Some of the activities organized by 3B during its circuits (e.g. paid visits to local villages and bringing tourists to local markets and cooperatives) will create additional business opportunities for local entrepreneurs. Also, 3B is expecting to continue its community engagement programs with generous donations, support to the vulnerable and the promotion of football among the local youth.
-Tax Benefits: The Project will result in fiscal benefits through increased tax generation.

The proposed investment would support 3B Group of Hotels (3B or the Company), one of Rwandas leading ecotourism groups, to expand its network of mid-tier lodging in Rwanda with investment in: (i) the completion of a 30-room Akagera Safari Camp in the Lakes District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda, (ii) the acquisition, refurbishment and putting into operation of the Nobilis Hotel, a 61-room hotel in Kigali and (iii) the introduction of a modern management information system (the Project).
